website_summaries.verdict: This is a child-sized classic exercise ball chair chair with good back support.
pros: When the ball is inflated properly, the support rests comfortably in the middle of the back
The wheels work well, and two of them can lock in place
cons: Assembly is difficult, and some say the plastic of the back support feels cheap

customer_reviews.title: Balls dont fit in the base
customer_reviews.text: The ball doesn't fit in the chair. I ordered the blue/green, pink/purple, & the gray/orange for my kiddos. All of the balls drag across the ground. Yes I did follow the instructions and deflate them on the second day to 50% and reinflated. Still dragged. The description says it comes with a 35cm ball. The photos show the ball bulging across the bar at the front and touching the back brace. I measured the distance straight across from the bar to the back and it was 40cm. The pictures are incredibly misleading. I'm keeping the base but now have to purchase 45cm balls so they will actually fit snugly and not sag through the hole.
customer_reviews.author: A. King

customer_reviews.title: Notice photo on Box/Pkg; Notice ball in adjacent photo of chair received - Seat Back not touching ball nor is metal rod support!
customer_reviews.text: What a joke! The ball is WAY smaller than what is shown in the photo! It is NOT as advertised and made a strong request with Amazon customer service to REMOVE this seller from its website immediately! What a waste of my time opening the package, putting it together and now have to re-package it, print a return label and paste it on the box and drive to a UPS store to return it. I'm very upset that this has wasted my entire morning when I have so much to do!
customer_reviews.author: A M

customer_reviews.title: Love love love it!!!
customer_reviews.text: We freakin love this chair!!!! I have an 8 year old who loves to draw and she says this chair is so comfortable while she's at her desk.
customer_reviews.author: Dana

customer_reviews.title: Use a stronger pump~
customer_reviews.text: This chair is great! Don't listen to the "ball is to small" reviews, you just need to use a stronger pump to get enough air into it. We used the air pump that came with our air mattress. The chair fits our 7 year old and our 9 year old (he is the model in the attached image). Smaller kids may have an issue sitting all the way back and touching the ground, I'd say this is the right size for k-4th grade.
customer_reviews.author: Stacey

customer_reviews.title: Well, I loved the idea
customer_reviews.text: My bffs are distance schooling their 6 year old granddaughter. There was a serious problem with getting her to sit still and stop figgetting! So I ordered this for them. She had a ball with it, not sitting on it, but playing with it!!!! Of course I would have made her sit on it to do her work, but I have found that she usually gets what she wants. They did order the stand for it, don't know how that is working out, have never seen her with it except to play with it. I had seen this on some programs that they were being used in schools, would work perfect if insisted in the proper use.
customer_reviews.author: perry93536

customer_reviews.title: Read the reviews. Believe them.
customer_reviews.text: This is a joke. I read reviews saying the ball is too big. The one we received is too small. Laughably so. Put it next to our small cat for scale. It doesn’t fit in the chair because it’s too small. The metal bar comes up over it.
customer_reviews.author: MC

customer_reviews.title: Well worth the purchase
customer_reviews.text: I find no faults in this chair. Our child is visually impaired and with that her ability to balance is not very good. We are using this chair backwards without the wheels so she can hold onto the back and bounce. I get on my yoga ball and we bounce together. This helps with her high activity level and her balance. Well worth the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: C Pruitt

customer_reviews.title: Returned
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my 8 year old when the indoor trampoline I purchased lost a leg so he could get in his daily, constant bouncing. I never even took it out of the box. When it came it said it was for kids up to 8 years old so I sent it back. I found out after that there isn't a yoga/sensory ball for people between 4'3" & 5' tall. I'm not really happy that this, meant for kids, was too small for an 8 year old.
customer_reviews.author: Shopaholic1321

customer_reviews.title: Nice but the ball is too small.
customer_reviews.text: Most kids' desks (at least for ages 4-8) are around 24 inches. I don't know, but this is the height I've seen for many kids' desks that I've shopped around for from different furniture stores. As nice as this ball chair is, it's way too short for kids' desks that are around 24". The ball that comes with this is way too small for this chair to be properly ergonomic. If the desk were 18-20 inches, then this would be great. I'm going to have to shop around for a replacement ball so my son can use this without messing up his posture from being too low.
customer_reviews.author: Law

customer_reviews.title: Sits lower than normal type desk chair
customer_reviews.text: This chair is amazing but it does not raise the child high enough to sit at a regular sized desk very comfortably so I ordered the chair extenders and it is perfect. I cheated to blow the ball up by inflating it just enough to get the wrinkles out stuffing it in a pillowcase and tossing it in the dryer for about 3 to 4 mins (heated the ball just enough to inflate fully) if it was sunny here right now I would have just left it in the sun for a bit. My son loves the chair and the orange ball is a great orange!!! I would definitely recommend this chair.
customer_reviews.author: Trish

customer_reviews.title: Much too small for sitting at a table or desk.
customer_reviews.text: The item is very short. I was afraid to buy the adult size for my 8 year old in fear his feet wouldn’t be able to touch the floor. This was for sitting at his desk. Now I regret getting the youth size because it is Really short! Hopefully I can salvage it with a larger exercise ball. The one that came with it didn’t get any larger even with the instructions recommendations, so it seems to small for the chair, itself. However, my son does love it and I have a one year old so I may still buy an adult one for him and give the littlest the youth size once she’s old enough for it.
customer_reviews.author: Tiff B.

customer_reviews.title: Ball was garbage
customer_reviews.text: So far TWO of the balls I ordered from this company were defective. Thin rubber in some areas caused the balls to rip before it was even filled to capacity. I have bought several ball chairs for my classroom over the past couple of years, so it wasn't user error. The quality is going down. They used to be nice and thick rubber. I guess popularity has caused the company to cut corners. NOT AT ALL HAPPY!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Teresa G. Cantarella

customer_reviews.title: It was easy to put together and my boys love it
customer_reviews.text: All of the reviewers saying that the ball is too small did not air it up enough. It states in the instructions to air it up to a certain measurement. Ours was 17". It takes a little common sense. It was easy to put together and my boys love it. I would buy this again and recommend it to anyone looking for a kids desk chair.
customer_reviews.author: Stacy C.

customer_reviews.title: Easy to assemble, well packaged, awesome for kid with ADHD
customer_reviews.text: We bought this for my six year old who is doing online Kindergarten this year. She has severe ADHD and has trouble sitting still so we were hoping this might help. Thus far, it has. It's been great and is the perfect size for young elementary school kids. It's on wheels that can lock which makes it easy to lock it in place so she can only bounce, and unlock so she can move around a little bit more. The color is true to the photo, the ball is supportive, and it was extremely easy to put together and blow up. This is a much higher quality ball than other brands we've tried.
customer_reviews.author: Chloe F.

customer_reviews.title: Too small, deflated easily
customer_reviews.text: It is a yoga ball for kids, but I think the size recommendations are off; I followed them with high hopes. My kid is average height for her age, but it’s too small for her (she’s 8). She is very entertained by how small it is, though. Sadly, the silliness of how short she is next to the tables at which she’s working negates the point in many ways. It is also difficult to inflate, even though we have everything we need to do so; the moment you remove the air hose, air is coming out. It also deflated quickly with use.
customer_reviews.author: DED

customer_reviews.title: BAD customer service
customer_reviews.text: I ordered the kids yoga ball. The product description included an air pump which is missing! I cannot get customer service on the phone and the email gave a response that they are busy and overwhelmed with too many emails. hum... I wonder why. The ball is a nice size for 5 year old children and I do like the ball. I don't like the product description to be misleading that an air pump is included when it is not. The brand should pay more attention to detail.
customer_reviews.author: Shauna Vartanian

customer_reviews.title: I love it! I ordered two more.
customer_reviews.text: My child has ADHD. It's hard for her to concentrate. First time using it, she was able to sit from 8:15am to 12:05pm. getting up twice to stretch and bathroom break. My other two children also have the wiggles and they go through their work bouncing, but the work gets done. I ordered two more. Also, I'm barely 5 feet tall and I can sit on it. It's very comfortable for me. So, I'm debating whether I should get the kids size for me or get the adult size one. Note: I didn't put the wheels on yet. But, since its working out, I will leave them off for now. I highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: ellaine

customer_reviews.title: Mostly great!
customer_reviews.text: You definitely have to read the instructions in that the ball has to be inflated and deflated and inflated again to reach max size. It is good but our ball came with spots all over it. Looks like something was melted on it. Not bothering with an exchange though because right now it’s just another thing to worry about doing and I got enough going on! Kids love sitting on it and it’s a good alternative to sitting in an office chair all day for the kids who will be at home for school.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa M Spinelli

customer_reviews.title: Very sturdy, yet extremely light
customer_reviews.text: Very sturdy, yet extremely light. Stable and durable. It was so easy to assemble that my 5y/o did most of the work and was very proud of herself afterwards. She even carried it most of the way into school this morning. She and her teacher are super excited about having this chair in her class this year. Not only will it be a great way to my "active" K-grader at her workspace and doing school work, it'll be a great incentive item to keep her on-task and following directions since she does NOT want it to be taken away or sent back home.
customer_reviews.author: Ecotrap Guard

customer_reviews.title: However the students LOVE this chair
customer_reviews.text: I bought 2 of these chairs for my classroom. I work with 3rd and 4th graders. The chair fit my 3rd graders well but was a bit short for my 4th graders in my opinion. However the students LOVE this chair! They bounce and work. The only issue I had was the amount of time to get the ball just right. It took about 1 week to pump the ball to expectation, so patience is needed (which can be hard for children, when they see a new item). After a week the chair was ready and it has been in use everyday. I am thinking of trying the adult chair for my 4th graders.
customer_reviews.author: JessJPas

customer_reviews.title: Economical and fun!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this chair for my daughter. In her school, they allowed having a chair of their own. We saw some other students with similar chairs so we searched Amazon and found something similar. She loves it. It was easy to set up and has lasted her almost 6 months now. It promotes good posture and gives her something to "play" with when she's allowed to take breaks.
customer_reviews.author: Kaldeem

customer_reviews.title: Chair is very small. I would suggest for 4 ...
customer_reviews.text: Chair is very small. I would suggest for 4 or 5 yr old. Having to return mine for the youth size. Grandchildren are 7 and 9 {small}. Not suitable for normal size youth desk.
customer_reviews.author: Mae

customer_reviews.title: Use a different pump.
customer_reviews.text: The ball problem is with the pump. You need to use a different pump. I used a soccer ball hand pump, but i think a bike pump would work too. You can unscrew the top off the pump and screw it on a hand pump. The purple/pink one came a day later, you can see the difference blowing up day 1 and day 2 with a proper pump.
customer_reviews.author: Lauren Coyle

customer_reviews.title: Great value,  color And the perfect size
customer_reviews.text: Using for my 6 yearold for our cardio drumming class. It's the perfect size for her and a great price for something that is hard to find. It's held up very well, been in and out of the car, thrown down the stairs, she bounces around on it watching tv. Ther color is bright and fun.
customer_reviews.author: Birdy7117

customer_reviews.title: Weird bar placement
customer_reviews.text: It has that oddly placed metal bar that makes it completely uncomfortable. The ball doesn’t expand as much as the photo. I followed the suggestions in the comments and also hbd product instructions and it just does not. The bar in the front makes it uncomfortable for my kids and I don’t really understand the point of it being there .
customer_reviews.author: Mason’s Mom

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy this.
customer_reviews.text: Save your money, get a different one. The bolts to hold the front stabilizer place were missing. The ball was tiny! Seriously like baby sized. It looked like it was going to fall through the normal size base, but was just barely big enough not to fall all the way through. The bolts to hold the back on weren't long enough to actually hold it together. The base was fine.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda

customer_reviews.title: Considering the other reviews. You can't guarantee a reliable chair.
customer_reviews.text: To assemble the chair was quite easy but you have to make sure to screw on the metal bar really well or else your kid will unscrew it easily. The locks on the rollers DO NOT WORK. The chair will still roll when it's locked. So be careful and aware of how your child is using it. The ball was very hard to pump to size. And even then I believe it's not the size it needs to be. I'm not returning bc too much of a hassle. My kids do enjoy bouncing and sitting on it.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica M

customer_reviews.title: Great alternative to uncomfortable chairs
customer_reviews.text: These chairs are amazingly comfortable and fun. The kids get their work done with no problem and get some extra excersise rolling across the floor. Some people said the ball was too small for the chair but it holds a lot of air...just keep pumping and it will fit.
customer_reviews.author: nic

customer_reviews.title: I love these chairs and used them in my classroom with ...
customer_reviews.text: I love these chairs and used them in my classroom with young children. I would recommend having serious discussions with your students about them though, I have had TWO different children pierce them with their pencils.
customer_reviews.author: Kathleen Breakey

customer_reviews.title: Hand pump is useless for this ball
customer_reviews.text: Great chair. However, hand pump will not suffice to inflate it at the right size. You’d need a bike pump or small compressor. It takes longer than 24 hrs to stretch the ball safely without popping. I did 48 hrs to inflate it at right size and waited another 24 hrs before use.
customer_reviews.author: Denisse

customer_reviews.title: Great for adult or kids. Great purchase.
customer_reviews.text: I used this behind a small table at work in a school. It let me roll around to reach for things. It was softer than using a regular small chair. It helped me maintain better posture. When I had a hyperactive or disengaged child, would let him or her borrow the chair and they immediately could focus better!
customer_reviews.author: LadySmileShopper

customer_reviews.title: Totally deceptive- do not buy
customer_reviews.text: I’m super disappointed. I have a Gaian ball chair for my office that I’ve had for years and love. This kid’s one is not at all what is shown in the package. The ball is way way too small and the whole thing is tiny. The picture on the box is completely deceptive.
customer_reviews.author: KelceyLu

customer_reviews.title: Great feedback from the teacher that this chair is helping my ADHD child!
customer_reviews.text: The teacher just called and said she sees a difference in my child's focus with this chair and it satisfies his need to move! He's 10 years old and has ADHD. I bought an extra one for the classroom and she's been rotating it around. She thinks all of the children are benefitting from it. It was easy to put together and such an affordable way to help our child be successful in class.
customer_reviews.author: California John

customer_reviews.title: love it, perfect!
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my son who has high functioning autism for his distance learning at home. Have had it for a week now and its perfect. He is a big 7yr old. This chair is perfect for now. Im sure next year i will have to size up but my 5yr old can take the hand me down.
customer_reviews.author: ESTELA LOZA

customer_reviews.title: Great for getting out wiggles
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for kindergartener who has the wiggles and it has worked WONDERFULLY. Followed instructions to inflate/deflate several times in cold and warm air and it worked like a charm. Kindergartener loves it because she can bounce around and kick legs out while learning instead of staying stationary in a standard chair. Other parents have bought similar products due to how successful it was with our LO.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for Fidgeting Students
customer_reviews.text: I first saw this chair in my son's class. He raved on how he liked it. Asked his teacher about it and she said how great it is for those fidgeting students. I decided to get one for doing homework and let's say, I have seen a great improvement. He is more focused. I'm considering an adult one for myself!
customer_reviews.author: Esther Robinson

customer_reviews.title: Great concept, poor execution...
customer_reviews.text: I love the idea of this product. This chair would be ideal for my 5 year old. However, while setting it up, the ball included is drastically smaller than the space it is supposed to fit into. The whole that is supposed to “hold” the ball isn’t at all in contact with the ball. The chair cannot roll because the ball is sitting on the ground. According to the description, the ball should be just above the ground. Over all, I love the concept but this is poor execution. I will be keeping the item in hopes to find an appropriate junior sized ball to make this product work.
customer_reviews.author: Emily Padgett

customer_reviews.title: I bought two of them for my kiddos and one of the balls is pretty small while the other one is even smaller--it drags ...
customer_reviews.text: the ball is nowhere near the size that is shown in the picture...I bought two of them for my kiddos and one of the balls is pretty small while the other one is even smaller--it drags on the ground! :( I guess I either need to return them or go and buy bigger balls to fit in there.
customer_reviews.author: gaming

customer_reviews.title: The chair is easy to assemble
customer_reviews.text: The chair is easy to assemble, durable and my kids love it. HOWEVER, It says for ages 5-8. I bought these for my three kids to use at their desks at home. My kids are ages 6, 8 and 9. I'd say 5 or 6 is the max age because they are so short and small. The ball looks like an average size exercise ball in the picture, when in reality it is about the size of a large kickball. I'm going to use these in my preschool classroom instead and buy adult size chair for my kids at home. They have a desk the height of a 3-drawer file cabinet and these chairs were WAY too short.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for kids who hate sitting still
customer_reviews.text: We got this chair when we found out we would be starting virtual school for our 6 year old who has adhd. It has helped so much! She bounces, and rolls All while doing school and being able to focus and expel a little energy.
customer_reviews.author: Katie101610

customer_reviews.title: Received missing pieces
customer_reviews.text: When we received our order the box was smashed. It was missing all the metal pieces to assemble the chair. It seems easy enough to assemble but without the piece is impossible to do.
customer_reviews.author: Sydney

customer_reviews.title: 8 years or younger, 48 inches tall
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for my active 8 year old. Who is 50 inches tall. I think that is the max height for this. It is a little short for a standard desk unless you max out the ball.
customer_reviews.author: Maris Stella

customer_reviews.title: Quality Product
customer_reviews.text: Great product and easy to assemble. I followed the instructions in another review and inflated the ball three nights in a row. Beautiful fit. Only con is that's it's too tiny (low) for my five year old. I think this would be perfect for a 3 year old
customer_reviews.author: Duchess

customer_reviews.title: Great but... you need a 45cm ball
customer_reviews.text: The chair is great and the right size. However, the ball is too small. You will need to order 45cm ball to fit the chair as shown on photos adding $15 to the total cost of the chair.
customer_reviews.author: Inga

customer_reviews.title: For kids in 1st and under
customer_reviews.text: This is a small chair for 1st grade and under not for 2nd grade and up. My son is in 3rd grade and met the size requirements and had to return it and get the adult chair.
customer_reviews.author: SkyDance

customer_reviews.title: I would buy these again
customer_reviews.text: No problems with the ball size. I didn’t even have to re-inflate it after 24 hours. My students love them and several parents have asked where to buy them after seeing them in the classroom.
customer_reviews.author: susan

customer_reviews.title: Too short for a regular desk.
customer_reviews.text: For some reason I thought this chair would be taller. Unfortunately it is too short for a regular sized desk. It would probably work well with a child's desk. The chair itself is great and my son loves it. Plus it's easy for him to wheel around his room (i.e.: in front of his fish tank) which is convenient.
customer_reviews.author: CBTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Good chair for kids classroom
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my son’s classroom. The kids all enjoy sitting on it and it helps them to move a bit and helps with their posture. I found that you need to blow up the ball and let it sit for the night. Then add more air in the morning. It has deflated a bit over the month, but it’s really easy to add more air in with the pump provided.
customer_reviews.author: Seamee

customer_reviews.title: Not appropriate for normal children's desk
customer_reviews.text: Bought two of these for my elementary aged children for virtual school. They're too low for their desks and obviously cannot be adjusted/ raised. The ergonomics is all off and it's such a bummer. Of course, I can't return... Save your $$ and be sure to get a height adjustable seat, use a stool at their feet if they're dangling.
customer_reviews.author: Anon.

customer_reviews.title: Good!
customer_reviews.text: The only thing I don’t like about this chair is the casters don’t lock in place so it’s always moving backwards. That being said, my son loves this
customer_reviews.author: Christine Wolan

customer_reviews.title: Good product, worth it.
customer_reviews.text: It is a great product. I do recommend you buy the original normal size chair if your child is even just slightly over the curb in terms of height. Our 3rd grader is taller than 95% of his class and this chair is small for him. Consider if you have a kids desk or a normal desk as well.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: WAY TOO SMALL OF A BALL AND IT'S DEFORMED!
customer_reviews.text: I am beyond disappointed. First of all, the ball is WAY too small. Second of all, after DAYS of letting my ball deflate and re-inflate, this is how it looks. This is not okay. It looks NOTHING like the picture because the ball is TOO SMALL!!! I am a teacher and bought this for my class. Absolute waste of $70. I will change my review if the company does something to fix the problem.
customer_reviews.author: JJ

customer_reviews.title: Nice chair but moves alot
customer_reviews.text: The is a cute chair for my toddler. A great alternative to the traditional chair. However, the locks on the back legs don't work and it moves alot.
customer_reviews.author: gmbaker

customer_reviews.title: Neat chair
customer_reviews.text: Fits perfect was concerned about size of ball but used a bicycle pump and pumped it up past the point I thought it might be to much but it wasn't my 10 year old who is small for his age fits on it perfect.
customer_reviews.author: CMG

customer_reviews.title: Ball too small for chair
customer_reviews.text: The ball that came with the chair DIDNOT FIT the chair. It was way too small. I will be contacting the company today to send a replacement.
customer_reviews.author: Katie W.

customer_reviews.title: Great for a fidgety kid.
customer_reviews.text: Got this for our second grader for school. It has enough movement for a fidgety kid but is sturdy enough that they aren't all over the place. Many reviews complained about the ball touching the ground when placed in the chair. The ball takes time to relax and expand. Refilled 12-24 hours after initial inflation and it was perfect. Assembly was easy and took about 5 minutes.
customer_reviews.author: VTMomma

customer_reviews.title: Perfect size for 4'2 child
customer_reviews.text: My daughter wanted a yoga ball to exercise on with me at home. This one fits her perfectly. She is 50.5 inches tall. It came quickly ad was easy to fill up with bike pump.
customer_reviews.author: ashley

customer_reviews.title: ok..
customer_reviews.text: wheels scratched up the floor, the locks do not work totally and ball fits odd into seat. Ball popped and was glad to be rid of it did not help him focus at all seemed to make it worse.
customer_reviews.author: Dawn Baldridge

customer_reviews.title: Pre-k kid chair
customer_reviews.text: I teach kinder and these chairs are too small for them. This is recommended more for kids from 3-4 years old. My students don’t even sit on them. It was a waist of money.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth

customer_reviews.title: Try a different pump
customer_reviews.text: The pump that this comes with is inferior. Definitely have to use a different pump to get the ball true to size. The height that my 8 year old sits at with the ball fully inflated to his desk is lower than expected and he is smaller than most 8 year olds. I would not purchase if you have a very tall desk or taller child.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I got this for my granddaughter who has difficulty concentrating ...
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my granddaughter who has difficulty concentrating while doing homework -- not unlike her Grammy has always been. She loves it. She couldn't wait to get a desk and the chair into her room for her own "study space".
customer_reviews.author: Lynne Wagner

customer_reviews.title: just right for 11yo child
customer_reviews.text: I bought for my 11yo for school desk area at home...child is 4'-10". Had bought an adult size ball/chair but it was way too tall. Was worried this would be too short but ball height on the stand is just the right height to sit at their desk. Seems sturdy too.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: nice comfortable chair ball
customer_reviews.text: My son loved it... it keeps him bouncing and engaging in class like he is just playing and not getting bored for a 2 hours online class.
customer_reviews.author: Eda K.

customer_reviews.title: Issues with inflation
customer_reviews.text: My students love this chair but the ball never got as big as it needed to be. I followed the directions and deflated and re-inflated the ball numerous times but it still is not adequate. I put a small inflated ball I already had in the chair and it works wonderfully. I would love to have another chair but do not want the additional payment of investing in another ball. So sad because the chair is awesome.
customer_reviews.author: lgilliam

customer_reviews.title: Wrong parts for assembly
customer_reviews.text: The ball sent with this chair was way too small for the frame- so small that it fell through the bottom of the chair frame to the floor. Clearly the wrong size ball was paired with the the chair frame. Also the wrong size screws were sent to attach the chair back to the base. Wrong parts for assembly. We did purchase the adult size chair and it assembled easily. We are really happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Ann K. Pettigrew

customer_reviews.title: Ok but I’m not sure about wear and tear
customer_reviews.text: The ball does get big enough if you follow the instructions of taking a couple days to inflate. However, my yoga balls look like they have stretch marks where the material is much thinner, I’m scared those areas are going to rip
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Be careful
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these for my classroom of third graders. They were very excited to sit on it. They actually flip over because the back piece is too low. They have to sit on it like they are riding a horse so it does not flip
customer_reviews.author: Kathleen

customer_reviews.title: ball doesn't fit
customer_reviews.text: The ball that was shipped with this chair is TOO SMALL. It falls through the hole, goes to the ground making the wheels lift off the ground and thus making this dangerous and ineffective. They need to send a bigger ball with this chair.
customer_reviews.author: jordan

customer_reviews.title: Great ball
customer_reviews.text: Exactly the right size for my son. It was the wrong size for the chair we have, but perfect for his size.
customer_reviews.author: Linda

customer_reviews.title: You need a bike pump or different pump to get ball to streach to the correct size
customer_reviews.text: This is a great product for the price. You do need a better pump then they provide we used a bike pump to get the ball to stretch. We took it to my son’s second grade class and it’s working to keep him calm.
customer_reviews.author: Duramaterof4

customer_reviews.title: Great for Baby's Physical Therapy
customer_reviews.text: My 7 month old is in Physical Therapy for nerve damage to her arm at birth, leaving her with Erb's Palsy. I got this ball to be able to do more of her excercises at home. This is perfect! Perfect size! Plus, she loves playing with it!
customer_reviews.author: VikingRN

customer_reviews.title: Amazon was great and replaced but lost time on project and they ...
customer_reviews.text: Bought 3 for daughter's project. One frame was difficult to put together. Two of the balls were too small so they were digging on floor. Blew one up more and it two days later it burst. Amazon was great and replaced but lost time on project and they are not cheap so would have expected quality control to be better
customer_reviews.author: SP

customer_reviews.title: Creative chair encourages imaginative minds.
customer_reviews.text: This chair is another creative "toy" for inside and outside. It comes apart so ball can be kicked about the yard - through the "traffic cones" that I purchased along with this chair. The nearly 5 year old sits on the chair to read or enjoy his favorite TV program after energetic outside play with the ball. Another grandchild (also nearly 5 & has long legs) sits on the chair backward to wheel about the house. The balance ball chair has proven to be a good purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Ellen

customer_reviews.title: Ball is too small
customer_reviews.text: This is how our chair looks after inflating and deflating no less than 10 times with an electric pump. There is no way this ball is stretching to get puck enough to sit correctly in the chair. I’ve emailed the company. If they respond and help I’ll update the review.
customer_reviews.author: Lowrine

customer_reviews.title: Takes a few days to assemble.
customer_reviews.text: Took a couple of days to inflate and deflate the ball to get it to the right size ( as per instructions). The back of the chair isnt meant to be supportive. But after the hassle of assembling it,it works great for my little one.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley

customer_reviews.title: BALL WAY TOO SMALL. INEFFECTIVE.
customer_reviews.text: Completely false advertising as you can see in the picture, and this is the replacement. The yoga ball is way too small to fit in the frame. The ball is half the size than what it is in the picture. Do not order to avoid inconvenience and disappointment.
customer_reviews.author: Sara

customer_reviews.title: Too small!
customer_reviews.text: It was too small for the chair I was attempting to replace the ball for.
customer_reviews.author: Renee

customer_reviews.title: Great for school
customer_reviews.text: Our daughter loves it for school! Fits a smaller 10 year old great!
customer_reviews.author: Katherine S.

customer_reviews.title: I'd recommend getting the lifts for this as well
customer_reviews.text: I know some of the reviews say this, but it really is a small chair. I was a bit surprised when I opened it. I'd recommend getting the lifts for this as well. That being said, my 3.5 year old is totally happy with it!
customer_reviews.author: MegsMom

customer_reviews.title: We'll see!
customer_reviews.text: We're gonna deflate & inflate another time or three. Wish us luck!
customer_reviews.author: MGraczyk

customer_reviews.title: Balance Ball Bummed
customer_reviews.text: Not really what I wanted for my son. Its basically sitting unused in a corner.
customer_reviews.author: Dr. Marquis Grant

customer_reviews.title: Read amazon instructions for ball inflation.
customer_reviews.text: Like the reviews state had to inflate and deflate to get desired size ball. In all took three days. Good quality easy to assemble.
customer_reviews.author: elaine huerta

customer_reviews.title: Not fitted to chair size
customer_reviews.text: The balls that came with the chair do not fit. They are too small .
customer_reviews.author: mishawn greenfield

customer_reviews.title: Great for kids that need movement all day!
customer_reviews.text: Our son is a sensory seeker, constantly on the move, and was unable to sit in his chair at school. The yoga ball chair has given him the ability to move around without fear at getting in trouble. He's 8, and average height, so it'll be the right size until next year.
customer_reviews.author: S. Novak

customer_reviews.title: Tiny ball chair!
customer_reviews.text: Misleading on size...I thought this would fit my rather small 55 pound 9 year old- but it’s tiny!!! I bought it for him to use at school, but this is way too small. I’m either returning it or will see if it will fit his younger brother. On the plus side, super easy to assemble.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fun as a chair
customer_reviews.text: My grandson uses it as a chair as well as a exercise ball
customer_reviews.author: Jill McFalls

customer_reviews.title: This chair is very short. It doesn't even reach ...
customer_reviews.text: This chair is very short. It doesn't even reach our shortest desk. My kids use it to roll each other around the house so I am going to bring it to school and give to the teacher to utilize somehow
customer_reviews.author: Mt. View Parents

customer_reviews.title: why would anyone make a ball chair where the ball doesn't fit?
customer_reviews.text: I bought the orange grey option. fall slides right through, way to small. yes it's inflated. ... returning now.
customer_reviews.author: eco624

customer_reviews.title: The chair is a great tool for wiggly children while doing school work
customer_reviews.text: The chair is a great tool for wiggly children while doing school work. The Gaiam ball was very thin and popped within a week or two, I also had a friend that experienced the same thing. I ordered a replacement ball of the same size from a different company on Amazon which has done the trick. Overall the chair is great then ball was weak.
customer_reviews.author: SARA ALLISON

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy chairs
customer_reviews.text: A little smaller than I thought. Using with 9 year olds. But they are sturdy and work well. Best suited for 6-7 year olds. I should have gotten larger ones.
customer_reviews.author: Adam Chalmers

customer_reviews.title: Helps  improve posture and kids have so much fun
customer_reviews.text: My children loved it very much! They like to use it instead of the regular chair
customer_reviews.author: sabina

customer_reviews.title: They are PERFECT for little learners
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my 1st grade classroom. They are PERFECT for little learners!
customer_reviews.author: nquinto

customer_reviews.title: The product is of low quality. I had it ...
customer_reviews.text: The product is of low quality. I had it in my second grade classroom for 1 week. The ball deflated and many kids have tipped over backwards even with the wheel locks on.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Check the size before you buy.
customer_reviews.text: The product was fine. I returned it because it was too small for my grandson.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa Dehne

customer_reviews.title: Yoga Ball tiny
customer_reviews.text: The ball is tiny and slips through the chair. This is after reading you deflate the ball and reinflate it to blow up bigger. Did Not Work! Ridiculous and waste of money
customer_reviews.author: Smitty

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money
customer_reviews.text: The plastic is cheaply made, so the pieces didn't even fit together correctly. The back of the chair did not provide adequate support. Followed the instructions on stretching the rubber ball over 3 days and it never got big enough.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth

customer_reviews.title: perfect for a child
customer_reviews.text: Very well made, perfect for a child. Takes the fidgets out of a fidgety child.
customer_reviews.author: George a roosz

customer_reviews.title: Okay but
customer_reviews.text: It’s good but the ball was 3 sizes too small. I had to go buy a different one on top of spending money on the chair.
customer_reviews.author: Kathryn M. Barber

customer_reviews.title: We felt like this chair was nice but too small for both ...
customer_reviews.text: We felt like this chair was nice but too small for both our kids (5 and 7 yrs). What was listed as age on the website didn't match what the box said when we received it.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda

customer_reviews.title: Everything I was expecting
customer_reviews.text: Everything I thought it would be. So simple and easy to put together!! I only bought one to see how my two boys would like it. Well, they fight over it everyday. Guess we are going to get a second one.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

product_meta.title: Gaiam Kids Balance Ball Chair - Classic Children's Stability Ball Chair, Child Classroom Desk Seating
product_meta.description:
Make learning fun with the Gaiam Kids Balance Ball Chair! This ergonomic seat for children designed to promote concentration and active learning by giving kids an outlet for their excess energy. Kids will love this healthy and fun alternative seating whether it's at home or in the classroom. This stability ball chair will excite your kids to learn, reduce restlessness and fidgeting while promoting a healthy posture. Statistics have shown that kids are able to focus more intently when actively balancing their body on a yoga ball. Perfect for flexible classroom seating with active, high energy students - keeping their mind focused and body engaged. Recommended for kids ages 5-7 or heights between 42" - 51" (42 to 51 inches tall). Weight limit: 175-pounds.

Includes:
- 35cm Balance Ball
- Air pump
- Adjustable back support bar
- Secure metal ball holder
- Easy-glide caster wheels (2 lockable)

Gaiam is a leading lifestyle brand with a mission to make yoga, fitness, and well-being accessible to all. Gaiam was created as a lifestyle company with the vision that, given a choice, people would choose a lifestyle that is healthy and life enhancing, for themselves, their families and the Earth. The Gaiam wellness, yoga, meditation, and recovery lifestyle is a vote for individual health as well as the future sustainability of the Earth's resources. Gaiam strives to provide customers with alternatives to traditional products by offering natural or healthy versions that compare with the style, quality and price of conventional products.
feature_bullets: ALTERNATIVE DESK CHAIR: The perfect kid-sized seat for improving concentration & focus at home or in the classroom at their desk, this exercise ball chair helps to reduce restlessness, fidgeting and prevent boredom

ACTIVE LEARNING CHAIR: Stability ball chair promotes a healthy posture & keeps the mind focused and body engaged - Statistics have shown that kids are able to focus more intently when actively balancing their body on a balance ball

RECOMMENDED USER HEIGHT: Designed for kids ages 5-7, or children between 42 and 51 inches tall making this active sitting chair ideal for preschool, 1st and 2nd grade students. Weight limit: 175-pounds.
INCLUDES: Child-sized 38cm balance ball, easy-inflation air pump, adjustable back support bar, secure metal ball holder, and easy-glide caster wheels (2 lockable)

INFLATION INSTRUCTIONS: For a perfect fit, it may be necessary to re-inflate the ball once or twice after the initial inflation to stretch to its final size. Inflate ball with air, let stand for 24 hours, deflate 50% then fill again to 38cm height.
